verses.text: O God, Sovereign Lord, the Father of our Lord and God and Saviour Jesus Christ, we pray and beseech Thee to grant that our king may enjoy peace, and be just and brave.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:32
verses.text: Subdue under him, O God, all his adversaries and enemies.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:33
verses.text: Gird on thy shield and armour, and rise to his aid.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:34
verses.text: Give him the victory, O God, that his heart may be set on peace and the praise of Thy holy name, that we too in his peaceful reign may spend a calm and tranquil life in all reverence and godly fear, through the grace, mercy, and love of Thine only-begotten Son:  (In a loud voice.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:35
verses.text: )  Through whom and with whom be glory and power to Thee, with Thy most holy, good, and life-giving Spirit, now, henceforth, and for evermore.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:36
verses.text: The People.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:37
verses.text: Amen.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:38
verses.text: The Priest.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:39
verses.text: III.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:40
verses.text: Peace be to all.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:41
verses.text: The People.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:42
verses.text: And to thy spirit.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:43
verses.text: The Deacon.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:44
verses.text: Pray for the papas and the bishop.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:45
verses.text: The People.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:46
verses.text: Lord, have mercy; Lord, have mercy; Lord, have mercy.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:47
verses.text: The Priest.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:48
verses.text: O Sovereign and Almighty God, the Father of our Lord, God, and Saviour Jesus Christ, we pray and beseech Thee to defend in Thy good mercy our most holy and blessed high priest our Father in God Δ, and our most reverend Bishop Δ.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:49
verses.text: Preserve them for us through many years in peace, while they according to Thy holy and blessed will fulfil the sacred priesthood committed to their care, and dispense aright the word of truth; with all the orthodox bishops, elders, deacons, sub-deacons, readers, singers, and laity, with the entire body of the Holy and only Catholic Church.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:50
verses.text: Graciously bestow upon them peace, health, and salvation.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:51
verses.text: The prayers they offer up for us, and we for them, do Thou, O Lord, receive at Thy holy, heavenly, and reasonable altar.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:52
verses.text: But all the enemies of Thy Holy Church put Thou speedily under their feet, through the grace, mercy, and love of Thine only-begotten Son:  (Aloud.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:53
verses.text: )  Through whom and with whom be glory and power to Thee, with Thy all-holy, good, and life-giving Spirit, now, henceforth, and for evermore.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:54
verses.text: The People.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:55
verses.text: Amen.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:56
verses.text: The Priest.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:57
verses.text: IV.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:58
verses.text: Peace be to all.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:59
verses.text: The People.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:60
verses.text: And to thy spirit.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:61
verses.text: The Deacon.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:62
verses.text: Stand and pray.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:63
verses.text: The People.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:64
verses.text: Lord have mercy (thrice).

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:65
verses.text: The Priest offers up the prayer of entrance, and for incense.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:66
verses.text: The Priest.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:67
verses.text: O Sovereign Lord our God, who hast chosen the lamp of the twelve apostles with its twelve lights, and hast sent them forth to proclaim throughout the whole world and teach the Gospel of Thy kingdom, and to heal sickness and every weakness among the people, and hast breathed upon their faces and said unto them, Receive the Holy Spirit the Comforter: whosesoever sins ye remit, they are remitted unto them; and whosesoever sins ye retain, they are retained: Breathe also Thy Holy Spirit upon us Thy servants, who, standing around, are about to enter on Thy holy service, upon the bishops, elders, deacons, readers, singers, and laity, with the entire body of the Holy Catholic and Apostolic Church.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:68
verses.text: From the curse and execration, from condemnation, imprisonment, and banishment, and from the portion of the adversary;  O Lord, deliver us.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:69
verses.text: Purify our lives and cleanse our hearts from all pollution and from all wickedness, that with pure heart and conscience we may offer to Thee this incense for a sweet-smelling savour, and for the remission of our sins and the sins of all Thy people, through the grace, mercy, and love of Thine only-begotten Son:  (Aloud.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:70
verses.text: )  Through whom and with whom be the glory and the power to Thee, with Thy all-holy, good, and life-giving Spirit, now, henceforth, and for evermore.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:71
verses.text: The People.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:72
verses.text: Amen.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:73
verses.text: The Deacon.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:74
verses.text: V.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:75
verses.text: Stand.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:76
verses.text: They sing:—  Only-begotten Son and Word, etc.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:77
verses.text: The Gospel is carried in, and the Deacon says:—  Let us pray.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:78
verses.text: The Priest.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:79
verses.text: Peace be to all.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:80
verses.text: The People.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:81
verses.text: And to thy spirit.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:82
verses.text: The Deacon.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:83
verses.text: Let us pray.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:84
verses.text: The People.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:85
verses.text: Lord, have mercy.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:86
verses.text: The Priest says the prayer of the Trisagion.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:87
verses.text: O Sovereign Lord Christ Jesus, the co-eternal Word of the eternal Father, who wast made in all things like as we are, but without sin, for the salvation of our race; who hast sent forth Thy holy disciples and apostles to proclaim and teach the Gospel of Thy kingdom, and to heal all disease, all sickness among Thy people, be pleased now, O Lord, to send forth Thy light and Thy truth.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:88
verses.text: Enlighten the eyes of our minds, that we may understand Thy divine oracles.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:89
verses.text: Fit us to become hearers, and not only hearers, but doers of Thy word, that we, becoming fruitful, and yielding good fruit from thirty to an hundred fold, may be deemed worthy of the kingdom of heaven.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:90
verses.text: (Aloud.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:91
verses.text: )  Let Thy mercy speedily overtake us, O Lord.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:92
verses.text: For Thou art the bringer of good tidings, the Saviour and Guardian of our souls and bodies; and we offer glory, thanks, and the Trisagion to Thee, the Father, Son, and Holy Ghost, now, henceforth, and for evermore.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:93
verses.text: The People.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:94
verses.text: Amen.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:95
verses.text: Holy God, holy mighty, holy immortal.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:96
verses.text: Holy, holy, holy, etc.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:97
verses.text: VI.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:98
verses.text: After the Trisagion the Priest makes the sign of the cross over the people, and says:—  Peace be to all.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:99
verses.text: The People.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:100
verses.text: And to thy spirit.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:101
verses.text: Then follow the Let us attend; The Apostle and Prologue of the Hallelujah.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:102
verses.text: The Deacons, after a prescribed form, say:—  Lord, bless us.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:103
verses.text: The Priest says:—  May the Lord in His mercy bless and help us, now, henceforth, and for evermore.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:104
verses.text: The Priest, before the Gospel is read, offers incense, and says:—  Accept at Thy holy, heavenly, and reasonable altar, O Lord, the incense we offer in presence of Thy sacred glory.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:105
verses.text: Send down upon us in return the grace of Thy Holy Spirit, for Thou art blessed, and let Thy glory encircle us.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:106
verses.text: VII.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:107
verses.text: The Deacon, when he is about to read the Gospel, says:—  Lord, bless us.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:108
verses.text: The Priest.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:109
verses.text: May the Lord, who is the blessed God, bless and strengthen us, and make us hearers of His holy Gospel, now, henceforth, and for evermore, Amen.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:110
verses.text: The Deacon.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:111
verses.text: Stand and let us hear the holy Gospel.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:112
verses.text: The Priest.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:113
verses.text: Peace be to all.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:114
verses.text: The People.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:115
verses.text: And to thy spirit.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:116
verses.text: VIII.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:117
verses.text: The Deacon reads the Gospel, and the Priest says the prayer of the Collect.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:118
verses.text: Look down in mercy and compassion, O Lord, and heal the sick among Thy people.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:119
verses.text: May all our brethren who have gone or who are about to go abroad, safely reach their destination in due season.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:120
verses.text: Send down the gracious rain upon the thirsty lands, and make the rivers flow in full stream, according to Thy grace.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:121
verses.text: The fruits of the land do Thou, O Lord, fill with seed and make ripe for the harvest.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:122
verses.text: In peace, courage, justice, and tranquillity preserve the kingdom of Thy servant, whom Thou hast deemed worthy to reign over this land.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:123
verses.text: From evil days, from famine and pestilence, from the assault of barbarians, defend, O Lord, this Christ-loving city, lowly and worthy of Thy compassion, as Thou didst spare Nineveh of old.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:124
verses.text: For Thou art full of mercy and compassion, and rememberest not the iniquities of men against them.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:125
verses.text: Thou hast said through Thy prophet Isaiah,—I will defend this city, to save it for mine own sake, and for my servant David's sake.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:126
verses.text: Wherefore we pray and beseech Thee to defend in Thy good mercy this city, for the sake of the martyr and evangelist Mark, who has shown us the way of salvation through the grace, mercy, and love of Thine only-begotten Son.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:127
verses.text: (Aloud.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:128
verses.text: )  Through whom and with whom be glory and power to Thee, with Thy all-holy, good, and life-giving Spirit.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:129
verses.text: The Deacon.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:130
verses.text: IX.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:131
verses.text: Begin.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:132
verses.text: Then they say the verse.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:133
verses.text: The Deacon says—The three.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:134
verses.text: The Priest.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:135
verses.text: O Sovereign and Almighty God, the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, we pray and beseech Thee to fill our hearts with the peace of heaven, and to bestow moreover the peace of this life.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:136
verses.text: Preserve for us through many years our most holy and blessed Papas Δ, and our most pious Bishop Δ, while they, according to Thy holy and blessed will, peacefully fulfil the holy priesthood committed to their care, and dispense aright the word of truth, with all the orthodox bishops, elders, deacons, sub-deacons, readers, singers, with the entire body of the holy Catholic and Apostolic Church.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:137
verses.text: Bless our meetings, O Lord.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:138
verses.text: Grant that we may hold them without let or hindrance, according to Thy holy will.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:139
verses.text: Be pleased to give to us, and Thy servants after us for ever, houses of praise and prayer.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:140
verses.text: Rise, O Lord, and let Thine enemies be scattered.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:141
verses.text: Let all who hate Thy holy name be put to flight.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:142
verses.text: Bless Thy faithful and orthodox people.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:143
verses.text: Multiply them by thousands and tens of thousands.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:144
verses.text: Let no deadly sin prevail against them, or against Thy holy people, through the grace, mercy, and love of Thine only-begotten Son.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:145
verses.text: (Aloud.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:146
verses.text: )  Through whom and with whom be glory and power to Thee, with Thy all-holy, good, and life-giving Spirit.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:147
verses.text: The People.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:148
verses.text: Amen.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:149
verses.text: The Priest.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:150
verses.text: Peace be to all.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:151
verses.text: The People.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:152
verses.text: And to thy spirit.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:153
verses.text: The Deacon.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:154
verses.text: Take care that none of the catechumens—  II.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:155
verses.text: Then they sing the Cherubic hymn.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:156
verses.text: X.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:157
verses.text: The Priest offers incense at the entrance, and prays:—  O Lord our God, who lackest nothing, accept this incense offered by an unworthy hand, and deem us all worthy of Thy blessing, for Thou art our sanctification, and we ascribe glory to Thee.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:158
verses.text: The holy things are carried to the altar, and the Priest prays thus:—  O holy, highest, awe-inspiring God, who dwellest among the saints, sanctify us, and deem us worthy of Thy reverend priesthood.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:159
verses.text: Bring us to Thy precious altar with a good conscience, and cleanse our hearts from all pollution.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:160
verses.text: Drive away from us all unholy thoughts, and sanctify our souls and minds.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:161
verses.text: Grant that, with reverence of Thee, we may perform the service of our holy fathers, and propitiate Thy presence through all time; for Thou art He who blesseth and sanctifieth all things, and to Thee we ascribe glory and thanks.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:162
verses.text: The Deacon.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:163
verses.text: XI.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:164
verses.text: Salute one another.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:165
verses.text: The Priest says the prayer of salutation.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:166
verses.text: O Sovereign and Almighty Lord, look down from heaven on Thy Church, on all Thy people, and on all Thy flock.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:167
verses.text: Save us all, Thy unworthy servants, the sheep of Thy fold.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:168
verses.text: Give us Thy peace, Thy help, and Thy love, and send to us the gift of Thy Holy Spirit, that with a pure heart and a good conscience we may salute one another with an holy kiss, without hypocrisy, and with no hostile purpose, but guileless and pure in one spirit, in the bond of peace and love, one body and one spirit, in one faith, even as we have been called in one hope of our calling, that we may all meet in the divine and boundless love, in Christ Jesus our Lord, with whom Thou art blessed.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:169
verses.text: Then the Priest offers the incense, and says:—  The incense is offered to Thy name.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:170
verses.text: Let it ascend, we implore Thee, from the hands of Thy poor and sinful servants to Thy heavenly altar for a sweet-smelling savour, and the propitiation of all Thy people.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:171
verses.text: For all glory, honour, adoration, and thanks are due unto Thee, the Father, Son, and Holy Ghost, now, henceforth, and for evermore, Amen.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:172
verses.text: After the Salutation, the Deacon in a loud voice says:—  XII.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:173
verses.text: Stand and make the offering duly.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:174
verses.text: The Priest, making the sign of the cross over the disks and chalices, says in a loud voice (the Nicene Creed):—  I believe in one God, etc.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:175
verses.text: The Deacon.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:176
verses.text: Stand for prayer.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:177
verses.text: The Priest.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:178
verses.text: Peace be to all.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:179
verses.text: The Deacon.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:180
verses.text: Pray for those who present the offering.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:181
verses.text: The Priest says the prayer of the Oblation.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:182
verses.text: O Sovereign Lord, Christ Jesus the Word, who art equal in power with the Father and the Holy Spirit, the great high priest; the bread that came down from heaven, and saved our souls from ruin; who gavest Thyself, a spotless Lamb, for the life of the world.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:183
verses.text: …  We pray and beseech Thee, O Lord, in Thy mercy, to let Thy presence rest upon this bread and these chalices on the all-holy table, while angels, archangels, and Thy holy priests stand round and minister for Thy glory and the renewing of our souls, through the grace, mercy, and love of Thine only-begotten Son, through whom and with whom be glory and power to Thee.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:184
verses.text: And when the People say,  And from the Holy Spirit was He made flesh;  The Priest makes the sign of the cross, and says:—  And was crucified for us.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:185
verses.text: The Priest makes the sign of the cross again, and says:—  And to the Holy Spirit.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:186
verses.text: III.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:187
verses.text: XIII.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:188
verses.text: In like manner also, as after the Creed, he makes the sign of the cross upon the People, and says aloud:—  The Lord be with all.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:189
verses.text: The People.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:190
verses.text: And with thy spirit.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:191
verses.text: The Priest.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:192
verses.text: Let us lift up our hearts.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:193
verses.text: The People.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:194
verses.text: We lift them up to the Lord.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:195
verses.text: The Priest.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:196
verses.text: Let us give thanks to the Lord.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:197
verses.text: The People.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:198
verses.text: It is meet and right.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:199
verses.text: The Priest begins the Anaphoral prayer.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:200
verses.text: O Lord God, Sovereign and Almighty Father, truly it is meet and right, holy and becoming, and good for our souls, to praise, bless, and thank Thee; to make open confession to Thee by day and night with voice, lips, and heart without ceasing;  To Thee who hast made the heaven, and all that is therein; the earth, and all that is therein; The sea, fountains, rivers, lakes, and all that is therein;  To Thee who, after Thine own image and likeness, hast made man, upon whom Thou didst also bestow the joys of Paradise;  And when he trespassed against Thee, Thou didst neither neglect nor forsake him, good Lord,  But didst recall him by Thy law, instruct him by Thy prophets, restore and renew him by this awful, life-giving, and heavenly mystery.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:201
verses.text: And all this Thou hast done by Thy Wisdom and the Light of truth, Thine only-begotten Son, our Lord, God, and Saviour Jesus Christ, Through whom, thanking Thee with Him and the Holy Spirit,  We offer this reasonable and bloodless sacrifice, which all nations, from the rising to the setting of the sun, from the north and the south, present to Thee, O Lord; for great is Thy name among all peoples, and in all places are incense, sacrifice, and oblation offered to Thy holy name.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:202
verses.text: XIV.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:203
verses.text: We pray and beseech Thee, O lover of men, O good Lord, remember in Thy good mercy the Holy and only Catholic and Apostolic Church throughout the whole world, and all Thy people, and all the sheep of this fold.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:204
verses.text: Vouchsafe to the hearts of all of us the peace of heaven, but grant us also the peace of this life.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:205
verses.text: Guide and direct in all peace the king, army, magistrates, councils, peoples, and neighbourhoods, and all our outgoings and incomings.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:206
verses.text: O King of Peace, grant us Thy peace in unity and love.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:207
verses.text: May we be Thine, O Lord; for we know no other God but Thee, and name no other name but Thine.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:208
verses.text: Give life unto the souls of all of us, and let no deadly sin prevail against us, or against all Thy people.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:209
verses.text: Look down in mercy and compassion, O Lord, and heal the sick among Thy people.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:210
verses.text: Deliver them and us, O Lord, from sickness and disease, and drive away the spirit of weakness.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:211
verses.text: Raise up those who have been long afflicted, and heal those who are vexed with unclean spirits.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:212
verses.text: Have mercy on all who are in prison, or in mines, or on trial, or condemned, or in exile, or crushed by cruel bondage or tribute.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:213
verses.text: Deliver them, O Lord, for Thou art our God, who settest the captives free; who raisest up the downtrodden; who givest hope to the hopeless, and help to the helpless; who liftest up the fallen; who givest refuge to the shipwrecked, and vengeance to the oppressed.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:214
verses.text: Pity, relieve, and restore every Christian soul that is afflicted or wandering.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:215
verses.text: But do Thou, O Lord, the physician of our souls and bodies, the guardian of all flesh, look down, and by Thy saving power heal all the diseases of soul and body.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:216
verses.text: Guide and prosper our brethren who have gone or who are about to go abroad.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:217
verses.text: Whether they travel by land, or river, or lake, by public road, or in whatever way journeying, bring them everywhere to a safe and tranquil haven.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:218
verses.text: Be pleased to be with them by land and sea, and restore them in health and joy to joyful and healthful homes.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:219
verses.text: Ever defend, O Lord, our journey through this life from trouble and storm.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:220
verses.text: Send down rich and copious showers on the dry and thirsty lands.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:221
verses.text: Gladden and revive the face of the earth, that it may spring forth and rejoice in the raindrops.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:222
verses.text: Make the waters of the river flow in full stream.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:223
verses.text: Gladden and revive the face of the earth with the swelling waters.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:224
verses.text: Fill all the channels of the streams, and multiply the fruits of the earth.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:225
verses.text: Bless, O Lord, the fruits of the earth, and keep them safe and unharmed.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:226
verses.text: Fill them with seed, and make them ripe for the harvest.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:227
verses.text: Bless even now, O Lord, Thy yearly crown of blessing for the sake of the poor of Thy people, the widow, the orphan, and the stranger, and for the sake of all of us who have our hope in Thee and call upon Thy holy name; for the eyes of all are upon Thee, and Thou givest them bread in due season.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:228
verses.text: O Thou who givest food to all flesh, fill our hearts with joy and gladness, that at all times, having all sufficiency, we may abound to every good work in Christ Jesus our Lord.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:229
verses.text: O King of kings and Lord of lords, defend the kingdom of Thy servant, our orthodox and Christ-loving sovereign, whom Thou hast deemed worthy to reign over this land in peace, courage, and justice.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:230
verses.text: Subdue under him, O Lord, every enemy and adversary, whether at home or abroad.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:231
verses.text: Gird on Thy shield and armour, and rise to his aid.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:232
verses.text: Draw Thy sword, and help him to fight against them that persecute him.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:233
verses.text: Shield him in the day of battle, and grant that the fruit of his loins may sit upon his throne.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:234
verses.text: Be kind to him, O Lord, for the sake of Thy Holy and Apostolic Church, and all Thy Christ-loving people, that we too in his peaceful reign may live a calm and tranquil life, in all reverence and godliness.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:235
verses.text: O Lord our God, give peace to the souls of our fathers and brethren who have fallen asleep in Jesus, remembering our forefathers of old, our fathers, patriarchs, prophets, apostles, martyrs, confessors, bishops, and the souls of all the holy and just men who have died in the Lord.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:236
verses.text: Especially remember those whose memory we this day celebrate, and our holy father Mark, the apostle and evangelist, who has shown us the way of salvation.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:237
verses.text: The Deacon.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:238
verses.text: Lord, bless us.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:239
verses.text: The Priest.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:240
verses.text: The Lord will bless thee in His grace, now, henceforth, and for evermore.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:241
verses.text: The Deacon reads the record of the dead.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:242
verses.text: The Priest bows and prays.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:243
verses.text: XV.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:244
verses.text: Give peace, O Sovereign Lord our God, to the souls of all who dwell in the tabernacles of Thy saints.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:245
verses.text: Graciously bestow upon them in Thy kingdom Thy promised blessing, which eye hath not seen, and ear hath not heard, nor has it entered into the heart of man what Thou, O God, hast prepared for those who love Thy holy name.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:246
verses.text: Give peace to their souls, and deem them worthy of the kingdom of heaven.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:247
verses.text: Grant that we may end our lives as Christians, acceptable unto Thee and without sin, and be pleased to give us part and lot with all Thy saints.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:248
verses.text: Accept, O God, by Thy ministering archangels at Thy holy, heavenly, and reasonable altar in the spacious heavens, the thank-offerings of those who offer sacrifice and oblation, and of those who desire to offer much or little, in secret or openly, but have it not to give.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:249
verses.text: Accept the thank-offerings of those who have presented them this day, as Thou didst accept the gifts of Thy righteous Abel:  The Priest offers incense, and says:—  As Thou didst accept the sacrifice of our father Abraham, the incense of Zacharias, the alms of Cornelius, and the widow's two mites, accept also the thank-offerings of these, and give them for the things of time the things of eternity, and for the things of earth the things of heaven.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:250
verses.text: Defend, O Lord, our most holy and blessed Papas Δ, whom Thou hast fore-ordained to rule over Thy Holy Catholic and Apostolic Church, and our most pious Bishop Δ, that they through many years of peace may, according to Thy holy and blessed will, fulfil the sacred priesthood committed to their care, and dispense aright the word of truth.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:251
verses.text: Remember the orthodox bishops everywhere, the elders, deacons, sub-deacons, readers, singers, monks, virgins, widows, and laity.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:252
verses.text: Remember, O Lord, the holy city of our God, Jesus Christ; and the imperial city; and this city of ours, and all cities and all lands, and the peace and safety of those who dwell therein in the orthodox faith of Christ.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:253
verses.text: Be mindful, O Lord, of the return of the back-sliding, and of every Christian soul that is afflicted and oppressed, and in need of Thy divine mercy and help.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:254
verses.text: Be mindful, O Lord, of our brethren in captivity.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:255
verses.text: Grant that they may find mercy and compassion with those who have led them captive.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:256
verses.text: Be mindful also of us, O Lord, Thy sinful and unworthy servants, and blot out our sins in Thy goodness and mercy.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:257
verses.text: Be mindful also of me, Thy lowly, sinful, and unworthy servant, and in Thy mercy blot out my sins.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:258
verses.text: Be with us, O Lord, who minister unto Thy holy name.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:259
verses.text: Bless our meetings, O Lord.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:260
verses.text: Utterly uproot idolatry from the world.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:261
verses.text: Crush under our feet Satan, and all his wicked influence.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:262
verses.text: Humble now, as at all times, the enemies of Thy Church.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:263
verses.text: Lay bare their pride.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:264
verses.text: Speedily show them their weakness.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:265
verses.text: Bring to naught the wicked plots they contrive against us.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:266
verses.text: Arise, O Lord, and let Thine enemies be scattered, and let all who hate Thy holy name be put to flight.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:267
verses.text: Do Thou bless a thousand times ten thousand Thy faithful and orthodox people while they do Thy holy will.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:268
verses.text: The Deacon.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:269
verses.text: Let those who are seated stand.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:270
verses.text: The Priest says the following prayer:—  Deliver the captive; rescue the distressed feed the hungry; comfort the faint-hearted, convert the erring; enlighten the darkened; raise the fallen; confirm the wavering; heal the sick; and guide them all, good Lord, into the way of salvation, and into Thy sacred fold.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:271
verses.text: Deliver us from our iniquities; protect and defend us at all times.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:272
verses.text: The Deacon.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:273
verses.text: Turn to the east.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:274
verses.text: The Priest bows and prays.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:275
verses.text: For Thou art far above all principality, and power, and might, and dominion, and every name that is named, not only in this world, but in that which is to come.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:276
verses.text: Round Thee stand ten thousand times ten thousand, and thousands of thousands of holy angels and hosts of archangels; and Thy two most honoured creatures, the many-eyed cherubim and the six-winged seraphim.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:277
verses.text: With twain they cover their faces, and with twain they cover their feet, and with twain they do fly; and they cry one to another for ever with the voice of praise, and glorify Thee, O Lord, singing aloud the triumphal and thrice-holy hymn to Thy great glory:—  Holy, holy, holy, Lord God of Sabaoth.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:278
verses.text: Heaven and earth are full of Thy glory.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:279
verses.text: (Aloud.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:280
verses.text: )  Thou dost ever sanctify all men; but with all who glorify Thee, receive also, O Sovereign Lord, our sanctification, who with them celebrate Thy praise, and say:—  The People.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:281
verses.text: Holy, holy, holy Lord.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:282
verses.text: The Priest makes the sign of the cross over the sacred mysteries.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:283
verses.text: XVI.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:284
verses.text: For truly heaven and earth are full of Thy glory, through the manifestation of our Lord and God and Saviour Jesus Christ.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:285
verses.text: Fill, O God, this sacrifice with Thy blessing, through the inspiration of Thy all-holy Spirit.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:286
verses.text: For the Lord Himself, our God and universal King, Christ Jesus, reclining at meat the same night on which He delivered Himself up for our sins and died in the flesh for all, took bread in His holy, pure, and immaculate hands, and lifting His eyes to His Father, our God, and the God of all, gave thanks; and when He had blessed, hallowed, and broken the bread, gave it to His holy and blessed disciples and apostles, saying:—  (Aloud.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:287
verses.text: )  Take, eat.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:288
verses.text: The Deacon.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:289
verses.text: Pray earnestly.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:290
verses.text: The Priest (aloud).

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:291
verses.text: For this is my body, which is broken for you, and divided for the remission of sins.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:292
verses.text: The People.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:293
verses.text: Amen.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:294
verses.text: The Priest prays.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:295
verses.text: After the same manner also, when He had supped, He took the cup of wine mingled with water, and lifting His eyes to Thee, His Father, our God, and the God of all, gave thanks; and when He had blessed and filled it with the Holy Spirit, gave it to His holy and blessed disciples and apostles, saying:—  (Aloud.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:296
verses.text: )  Drink ye all of it.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:297
verses.text: The Deacon.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:298
verses.text: Pray earnestly again.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:299
verses.text: The Priest (aloud).

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:300
verses.text: For this is my blood of the new testament which is shed for you and for many, and distributed among you for the remission of sins.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:301
verses.text: The People.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:302
verses.text: Amen.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:303
verses.text: The Priest prays thus:—  This do ye in remembrance of me; for as often as ye eat this bread and drink this cup, ye do show forth my death and acknowledge my resurrection and ascension until I come.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:304
verses.text: O Sovereign and Almighty Lord, King of heaven, while we show forth the death of Thine only-begotten Son, our Lord, God, and Saviour Jesus Christ, and acknowledge His blessed resurrection from the dead on the third day, we do also openly declare His ascension into heaven, and His sitting on the right hand of Thee, God and Father, and await His second terrible and dreadful coming, in which He will come to judge righteously the quick and the dead, and to render to each man according to his works.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:305
verses.text: XVII.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:306
verses.text: O Lord our God, we have placed before Thee what is Thine from Thine own mercies.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:307
verses.text: We pray and beseech Thee, O good and merciful God, to send down from Thy holy heaven, from the mansion Thou hast prepared, and from Thine infinite bosom, the Paraclete Himself, holy, powerful, and life-giving, the Spirit of truth, who spoke in the law, the apostles, and prophets; who is everywhere present, and filleth all things, freely working sanctification in whom He will with Thy good pleasure; one in His nature; manifold in His working; the fountain of divine blessing; of like substance with Thee, and proceeding from Thee; sitting with Thee on the throne of Thy kingdom, and with Thine only-begotten Son, our Lord and God and Saviour Jesus Christ.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:308
verses.text: Send down upon us also and upon this bread and upon these chalices Thy Holy Spirit, that by His all-powerful and divine influence He may sanctify and consecrate them, and make this bread the body.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:309
verses.text: The People.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:310
verses.text: Amen.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:311
verses.text: The Priest (aloud).

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:312
verses.text: And this cup the blood of the new testament, of the very Lord, and God, and Saviour, and universal King Christ Jesus.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:313
verses.text: The Deacon.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:314
verses.text: Deacons, come down.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:315
verses.text: The Priest (aloud).

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:316
verses.text: That to all of us who partake thereof they may tend unto faith, sobriety, healing, temperance, sanctification, the renewal of soul, body, and spirit, participation in the blessedness of eternal life and immortality, the glory of Thy most holy name, and the remission of sins, that Thy most holy, precious, and glorious name may be praised and glorified in this as in all things.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:317
verses.text: The People.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:318
verses.text: As it was and is.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:319
verses.text: The Priest.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:320
verses.text: XVIII.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:321
verses.text: Peace be to all.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:322
verses.text: The Deacon.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:323
verses.text: Pray.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:324
verses.text: The Priest prays in secret.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:325
verses.text: O God of light, Father of life, Author of grace, Creator of worlds, Founder of knowledge, Giver of wisdom, Treasure of holiness, Teacher of pure prayers, Benefactor of our souls, who givest to the faint-hearted who put their trust in Thee those things into which the angels desire to look: O Sovereign Lord, who hast brought us up from the depths of darkness to light, who hast given us life from death, who hast graciously bestowed upon us freedom from slavery, who hast scattered the darkness of sin within us, through the presence of Thine only-begotten Son, do Thou now also, through the visitation of Thy all-holy Spirit, enlighten the eyes of our understanding, that we may partake without fear of condemnation of this heavenly and immortal food, and sanctify us wholly in soul, body, and spirit, that with Thy holy disciples and apostles we may say this prayer to Thee: Our Father who art in heaven, etc.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:326
verses.text: (Aloud.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:327
verses.text: )  And grant, O Sovereign Lord, in Thy mercy, that we with freedom of speech, without fear of condemnation, with pure heart and enlightened soul, with face that is not ashamed, and with hollowed lips, may venture to call upon Thee, the holy God who art in heaven, as our Father, and say:—  The People.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:328
verses.text: Our Father who art in heaven, etc.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:329
verses.text: The Priest prays:—  Verily, Lord, Lord, lead us not into temptation, but deliver us from evil; for Thy abundant mercy showeth that we through our great infirmity are unable to resist it.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:330
verses.text: Grant that we may find a way whereby we may be able to withstand temptation; for Thou hast given us power to tread upon serpents, and scorpions, and all the power of the enemy.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:331
verses.text: (Aloud.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:332
verses.text: )  For Thine is the kingdom and power.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:333
verses.text: The People.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:334
verses.text: Amen.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:335
verses.text: The Priest.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:336
verses.text: XIX.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:337
verses.text: Peace be to all.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:338
verses.text: The Deacon.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:339
verses.text: Bow your heads to Jesus.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:340
verses.text: The People.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:341
verses.text: Thou, Lord.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:342
verses.text: The Priest prays.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:343
verses.text: O Sovereign and Almighty Lord, who sittest upon the cherubim, and art glorified by the seraphim; who hast made the heaven out of waters, and adorned it with choirs of stars; who hast placed an unbodied host of angels in the highest heavens to sing Thy praise for ever; before Thee have we bowed our souls and bodies in token of our bondage.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:344
verses.text: We beseech Thee to repel the dark assaults of sin from our understanding, and to gladden our minds with the divine radiance of Thy Holy Spirit, that, filled with the knowledge of Thee, we may worthily partake of the mercies set before us, the pure body and precious blood of Thine only-begotten Son, our Lord and God and Saviour Jesus Christ.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:345
verses.text: Pardon all our sins in Thy abundant and unsearchable goodness, through the grace, mercy, and love of Thine only-begotten Son:  (Aloud.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:346
verses.text: )  Through whom and with whom be glory and power to Thee, with the all-holy, good, and life-giving Spirit.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:347
verses.text: The Priest.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:348
verses.text: XX.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:349
verses.text: Peace be to all.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:350
verses.text: The Deacon.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:351
verses.text: With the fear of God.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:352
verses.text: The Priest prays.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:353
verses.text: O holy, highest, awe-inspiring God, who dwellest among the saints, sanctify us by the word of Thy grace and by the inspiration of Thy all-holy Spirit; for Thou hast said, O Lord our God, Be ye holy; for I am holy.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:354
verses.text: O Word of God, past finding out, consubstantial and co-eternal with the Father and the Holy Spirit, and sharer of their sovereignty, accept the pure song which cherubim and seraphim, and the unworthy lips of Thy sinful and unworthy servant, sing aloud.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:355
verses.text: The People.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:356
verses.text: Lord, have mercy; Lord, have mercy; Lord, have mercy.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:357
verses.text: The Priest (aloud).

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:358
verses.text: Holy things for the holy.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:359
verses.text: The People.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:360
verses.text: One Father holy, one Son holy, one Spirit holy, in the unity of the Holy Spirit, Amen.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:361
verses.text: The Deacon.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:362
verses.text: For salvation and help.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:363
verses.text: The Priest makes the sign of the cross upon the people, and saith in a loud voice:—  The Lord be with all.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:364
verses.text: The Priest breaks the bread, and saith:—  Praise ye God.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:365
verses.text: The Priest divides it among those present, and saith:—  The Lord will bless and help you through His great mercy.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:366
verses.text: The Priest says:—  Command.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:367
verses.text: The Clergy say:—  The Holy Spirit commands and sanctifies.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:368
verses.text: The Priest.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:369
verses.text: Lo, they are sanctified and consecrated.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:370
verses.text: The Clergy.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:371
verses.text: One holy Father, etc.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:372
verses.text: (thrice).

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:373
verses.text: The Priest says:—  The Lord be with all.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:374
verses.text: The Clergy.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:375
verses.text: And with thy spirit.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:376
verses.text: The Priest says:—  The Lord Himself hath blessed it.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:377
verses.text: The Priest partakes, and prays.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:378
verses.text: According to Thy loving-kindness, etc.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:379
verses.text: Or,  As the hart panteth after the water-brooks, etc.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:380
verses.text: When he gives the bread to the clergy, he says:—  The holy body.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:381
verses.text: And when he gives the chalice, he says:—  The precious blood of our Lord, and God, and Saviour.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:382
verses.text: IV.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:383
verses.text: After the service is completed, the Deacon says:—  XXI.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:384
verses.text: Stand for prayer.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:385
verses.text: The Priest.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:386
verses.text: Peace be to all.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:387
verses.text: The Deacon.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:388
verses.text: Pray.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:389
verses.text: The Priest says the prayer of thanksgiving.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:390
verses.text: O Sovereign Lord our God, we thank Thee that we have partaken of Thy holy, pure, immortal, and heavenly mysteries, which Thou hast given for our good, and for the sanctification and salvation of our souls and bodies.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:391
verses.text: We pray and beseech Thee, O Lord, to grant in Thy good mercy, that by partaking of the holy body and precious blood of Thine only-begotten Son, we may have faith that is not ashamed, love that is unfeigned, fulness of holiness, power to eschew evil and keep Thy commandments, provision for eternal life, and an acceptable defence before the awful tribunal of Thy Christ:  In a loud voice.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:392
verses.text: Through whom and with whom be glory and power to Thee, with Thy all-holy, good, and life-giving Spirit.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:393
verses.text: The Priest then turns to the people, and says:—  XXII.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:394
verses.text: O mightiest King, co-eternal with the Father, who by Thy might hast vanquished hell and trodden death under foot, who hast bound the strong man, and by Thy miraculous power and the enlightening radiance of Thy unspeakable Godhead hast raised Adam from the tomb, send forth Thy invisible right hand, which is full of blessing, and bless us all.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:395
verses.text: Pity us, O Lord, and strengthen us by Thy divine power.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:396
verses.text: Take away from us the sinful and wicked influence of carnal desire.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:397
verses.text: Let the light shine into our souls, and dispel the surrounding darkness of sin.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:398
verses.text: Unite us to the all-blessed assembly that is well-pleasing unto Thee; for through Thee and with Thee, all praise, honour, power, adoration, and thanksgiving are due unto the Father and the Holy Spirit, now, henceforth, and for evermore.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:399
verses.text: The Deacon.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:400
verses.text: Depart in peace:  The People.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:401
verses.text: In the name of the Lord.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:402
verses.text: The Priest (aloud).

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:403
verses.text: XXIII.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:404
verses.text: The love of God the Father; the grace of the Son, our Lord Jesus Christ; the communion and gift of the All-holy Spirit, be with us all, now, henceforth, and for evermore.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:405
verses.text: The People.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:406
verses.text: Amen.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:407
verses.text: Blessed be the name of the Lord.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:408
verses.text: The Priest prays in the sacristy, and says:—  O Lord, Thou hast given us sanctification by partaking of the all-holy body and precious blood of Thine only-begotten Son; give us the grace and gift of the All-holy Spirit.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:409
verses.text: Enable us to lead blameless lives; and guide us unto the perfect redemption, and adoption, and the everlasting joys of the world to come.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:410
verses.text: For Thou art our sanctification, and we ascribe glory unto Thee, the Father, and the Son, and the All-holy Spirit, now, henceforth, and for evermore.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:411
verses.text: The People.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:412
verses.text: Amen.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:413
verses.text: The Priest.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:414
verses.text: Peace be to all.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:415
verses.text: The People.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:416
verses.text: And to thy spirit.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 3:417
verses.text: The Priest dismisses them, and says:—  May God bless, who blesseth and sanctifieth, who defendeth and preserveth us all through the partaking of His holy mysteries; and who is blessed for ever, Amen.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:1
verses.text: The Liturgy of the Blessed Apostles.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:2
verses.text: Composed by St.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:3
verses.text: adaeus and St.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:4
verses.text: Maris, Teachers of the Easterns.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:5
verses.text: I.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:6
verses.text: First: Glory to God in the highest, etc.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:7
verses.text: Our Father which art in heaven.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:8
verses.text: Prayer.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:9
verses.text: Strengthen, O our Lord and God, our weakness through Thy mercy, that we may administer the holy mystery which has been given for the renovation and salvation of our degraded nature, through the mercies of Thy beloved Son the Lord of all.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:10
verses.text: On common days.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:11
verses.text: Adored, glorified, lauded, celebrated, exalted, and blessed in heaven and on earth, be the adorable and glorious name of Thine ever-glorious Trinity, O Lord of all.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:12
verses.text: On common days they sing the Psalm (xv.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:13
verses.text: ), Lord, who shall dwell in Thy tabernacle? entire with its canon, of the mystery of the sacraments.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:14
verses.text: (Aloud.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:15
verses.text: )  Who shall shout with joy? etc.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:16
verses.text: Prayer.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:17
verses.text: II.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:18
verses.text: Before the resplendent throne of Thy majesty, O Lord, and the exalted and sublime throne of Thy glory, and on the awful seat of the strength of Thy love and the propiatory altar which Thy will hath established, in the region of Thy pasture, with thousands of cherubim praising Thee, and ten thousands of seraphim sanctifying Thee, we draw near, adore, thank, and glorify Thee always, O Lord of all.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:19
verses.text: On commemorations and Fridays.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:20
verses.text: Thy name, great and holy, illustrious and blessed, the blessed and incomprehensible name of Thy glorious Trinity, and Thy kindness to our race, we ought at all times to bless, adore, and glorify, O Lord of all.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:21
verses.text: Responsory at the chancel, as above.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:22
verses.text: Who commanded, etc.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:23
verses.text: To the priest, etc.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:24
verses.text: Prayer.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:25
verses.text: How breathes in us, O our Lord and God, the sweet fragrance of the sweetness of Thy love; illumined are our souls, through the knowledge of Thy truth: may we be rendered worthy of receiving the manifestation of Thy beloved from Thy holy heavens: there shall we render thanks unto Thee, and, in the meantime, glorify Thee without ceasing in Thy Church, crowned and filled with every aid and blessing, because Thou art Lord and Father, Creator of all.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:26
verses.text: III.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:27
verses.text: Prayer of Incense.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:28
verses.text: We shall repeat the hymn to Thy glorious Trinity, O Father, Son, and Holy Ghost.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:29
verses.text: On fast-days.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:30
verses.text: And on account, etc.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:31
verses.text: At the commemoration of saints.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:32
verses.text: Thou, O Lord, art truly the raiser up of our bodies: Thou art the good Saviour of our souls, and the secure preserver of our life; and we ought to thank Thee continually, to adore and glorify Thee, O Lord of all.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:33
verses.text: At the lessons.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:34
verses.text: Holy art Thou, worthy of praise, mighty, immortal, who dwellest in the holies, and Thy will resteth in them: have regard unto us, O Lord; be merciful unto us, and pity us, as Thou art our helper in all circumstances, O Lord of all.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:35
verses.text: IV.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:36
verses.text: At the apostle.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:37
verses.text: Enlighten, O our Lord and God, the movements of our meditations to hear and understand the sweet listenings to Thy life-giving and divine commands; and grant unto us through Thy grace and mercy to gather from them the assurance of love, and hope, and salvation suitable to soul and body, and we shall sing to Thee everlasting glory without ceasing and always, O Lord of all.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:38
verses.text: On fast-days.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:39
verses.text: To Thee, the wise governor, etc.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:40
verses.text: V.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:41
verses.text: Descending, he shall salute the Gospel, saying this prayer before the altar.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:42
verses.text: Thee, the renowned seed of Thy Father, and the image of the person of Thy Father, who wast revealed in the body of our humanity, and didst arise to us in the light of Thy annunciation, Thee we thank, adore, etc.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:43
verses.text: And after the proclamation:—  Thee, O Lord God Almighty, we beseech and entreat, perfect with us Thy grace, and pour out through our hands Thy gift, the pity and compassion of Thy divinity.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:44
verses.text: May they be to us for the propitiation of the offences of Thy people, and for the forgiveness of the sins of the entire flock of Thy pasture, through Thy grace and tender mercies, O good friend of men, O Lord of all.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:45
verses.text: VI.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:46
verses.text: The Deacons say:—  Bow your heads.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:47
verses.text: The Priest says this secret prayer in the sanctuary:—  O Lord God Omnipotent, Thine is the Holy Catholic Church, inasmuch as Thou, through the great passion of Thy Christ, didst buy the sheep of Thy pasture; and from the grace of the Holy Spirit, who is indeed of one nature with Thy glorious divinity, are granted the degrees of the true priestly ordination; and through Thy clemency Thou didst vouchsafe, O Lord, to make our weakness spiritual members in the great body of Thy Holy Church, that we might administer spiritual aid to faithful souls.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:48
verses.text: Now, O Lord, perfect Thy grace with us, and pour out Thy gift through our hands: and may Thy tender mercies and the clemency of Thy divinity be upon us, and upon the people whom Thou hast chosen for Thyself.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:49
verses.text: (Aloud.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:50
verses.text: )  And grant unto us, O Lord, through Thy clemency, that we may all together, and equally every day of our life, please Thy divinity, and be rendered worthy of the aid of Thy grace to offer Thee praise, honour, thanksgiving, and adoration at all times, O Lord.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:51
verses.text: VII.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:52
verses.text: And the Deacons ascend to the altar, and say:—  He who has not received baptism, etc.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:53
verses.text: And the Priest begins the responsory of the mysteries, and the Sacristan and Deacon place the disk and the chalice upon the altar.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:54
verses.text: The Priest crosses his hands, and says:—  We offer praise to Thy glorious Trinity at all times and for ever.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:55
verses.text: And proceeds:—  May Christ, who was offered for our salvation, and commanded us to commemorate His death and His resurrection, Himself receive this sacrifice from the hands of our weakness, through His grace and mercies for ever, Amen.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:56
verses.text: And proceeds:—  Laid are the renowned holy and life-giving mysteries upon the altar of the mighty Lord, even until His advent, for ever, Amen.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:57
verses.text: Praise, etc.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:58
verses.text: Thy memory, etc.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:59
verses.text: Our Father, etc.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:60
verses.text: The apostles of the Father, etc.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:61
verses.text: Upon the holy altar, etc.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:62
verses.text: They who have slept, etc.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:63
verses.text: Matthew Mark, Luke, etc.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:64
verses.text: THE CREED.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:65
verses.text: VIII.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:66
verses.text: The Priest draws near to celebrate, and thrice bows before the altar, the middle of which he kisses, then the right and the left horn of the altar; and bows to the Gospel side, and says:—  Bless, O Lord, etc.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:67
verses.text: Pray for me, my fathers, brethren, and masters, that God may grant unto me the capability and power to perform this service to which I have drawn near, and that this oblation may be accepted from the hands of my weakness, for myself, for you, and for the whole body of the Holy Catholic Church, through His grace and mercies for ever, Amen.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:68
verses.text: And they respond:—  May Christ listen to thy prayers, and be pleased with thy sacrifice, receive thy oblation, and honour thy priesthood, and grant unto us, through thy mediation, the pardon of our offences, and the forgiveness of our sins, through His grace and mercies for ever.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:69
verses.text: Presently he bows at the other side, uttering the same words; and they respond in the same manner: then he bows to the altar, and says:—  God, Lord of all, be with us through His grace and mercies for ever, Amen.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:70
verses.text: And bowing towards the Deacon, who is on the left (Epistle side), he says:—  God, the Lord of all, confirm thy words, and secure to thee peace, and accept this oblation from my hands for me, for thee, for the whole body of the Holy Catholic Church, and for the entire world, through His grace and mercies for ever.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:71
verses.text: He kneels at the altar, and says in secret:—  IX.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:72
verses.text: O our Lord and God, look not on the multitude of our sins, and let not Thy dignity be turned away on account of the heinousness of our iniquities; but through Thine unspeakable grace sanctify this sacrifice of Thine, and grant through it power and capability, so that Thou mayest forget our many sins, and be merciful when Thou shalt appear at the end of time, in the man whom Thou hast assumed from among us, and we may find before Thee grace and mercy, and be rendered worthy to praise Thee with spiritual assemblies.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:73
verses.text: He rises, and says this prayer in secret:—  We thank Thee, O our Lord and God, for the abundant riches of Thy grace to us:  And he proceeds:—  Us who were sinful and degraded, on account of the multitude of Thy clemency, Thou hast made worthy to celebrate the holy mysteries of the body and blood of Thy Christ.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:74
verses.text: We beg aid from Thee for the strengthening of our souls, that in perfect love and true faith we may administer Thy gift to us.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:75
verses.text: Canon.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:76
verses.text: And we shall ascribe to Thee praise, glory, thanksgiving, and adoration, now, always, and for ever and ever.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:77
verses.text: He signs himself with the sign of the cross, and they respond:—  Amen.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:78
verses.text: X.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:79
verses.text: And he proceeds:—  Peace be with you:  They respond:—  With thee and with thy spirit.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:80
verses.text: And they give the (kiss of) peace to each other, and say:—  For all:  The Deacon says:—  Let us thank, entreat, and beseech.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:81
verses.text: The Priest says this prayer in secret:—  O Lord, mighty God, help my weakness through Thy clemency and the aid of Thy grace; and make me worthy of offering before Thee this oblation, as for the common aid of all, and to the praise of Thy Trinity, O Father, Son, and Holy Ghost.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:82
verses.text: Another prayer.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:83
verses.text: O our Lord and God, restrain our thoughts, that they wander not amid the vanities of this world.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:84
verses.text: O Lord our God, grant that I may be united to the affection of Thy love, unworthy though I be.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:85
verses.text: Glory be to Thee, O Christ.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:86
verses.text: Ascend into the chamber of Thy renowned light, O Lord; sow in me the good seed of humility; and under the wings of Thy grace hide me through Thy mercy.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:87
verses.text: If Thou wert to mark iniquities, O Lord, who shall stand? Because there is mercy with Thee.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:88
verses.text: The Priest says the following prayer in secret:—  O mother of our Lord Jesus Christ, beseech for me the only-begotten Son, who was born of thee, to forgive me my offences and my sins, and to accept from my feeble and sinful hands this sacrifice which my weakness offers upon this altar, through thy intercession for me, O holy mother.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:89
verses.text: XI.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:90
verses.text: When the Deacon shall say, With watchfulness and care, etc.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:91
verses.text: , immediately the Priest rises up and uncovers the sacraments, taking away the veil with which they were covered: he blesses the incense, and says a canon with a loud voice:—  The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ, and the love of God the Father, and the communion of the Holy Ghost, be with us all, now, etc.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:92
verses.text: He signs the sacraments, and they respond:—  Amen.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:93
verses.text: The Priest proceeds:—  Lift up your minds:  They respond:—  They are towards Thee, O God of Abraham, Isaac, and Israel, O glorious King.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:94
verses.text: The Priest.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:95
verses.text: The oblation is offered to God, the Lord of all.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:96
verses.text: They respond:—  It is meet and right.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:97
verses.text: The Deacon.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:98
verses.text: Peace be with you.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:99
verses.text: The Priest puts on the incense, and says this prayer:—  O Lord, Lord, grant me an open countenance before Thee, that with the confidence which is from Thee we may fulfil this awful and divine sacrifice with consciences free from all iniquity and bitterness.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:100
verses.text: Sow in us, O Lord, affection, peace, and concord towards each other, and toward every one.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:101
verses.text: And standing, he says in secret:—  Worthy of glory from every mouth, and of thanksgiving from all tongues, and of adoration and exaltation from all creatures, is the adorable and glorious name of Father, Son, and Holy Ghost, who created the world through His grace, and its inhabitants through His clemency, who saved men through His mercy, and showed great favour towards mortals.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:102
verses.text: Thy majesty, O Lord, thousands of thousands of heavenly spirits, and ten thousand myriads of holy angels, hosts of spirits, ministers of fire and spirit, bless and adore; with the holy cherubim and the spiritual seraphim they sanctify and celebrate Thy name, crying and praising, without ceasing crying unto each other.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:103
verses.text: They say with a loud voice:—  Holy, holy, holy, Lord God Almighty; full are the heavens and the earth of His glory.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:104
verses.text: The Priest in secret:—  Holy, holy, holy art Thou, O Lord God Almighty; the heavens and the earth are full of His glory and the nature of His essence, as they are glorious with the honour of His splendour; as it is written, The heaven and the earth are full of me, saith the mighty Lord.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:105
verses.text: Holy art Thou, O God our Father, truly the only one, of whom the whole family in heaven and earth is named.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:106
verses.text: Holy art Thou, Eternal Son, through whom all things were made.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:107
verses.text: Holy art Thou, Holy, Eternal Spirit, through whom all things are sanctified.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:108
verses.text: Woe to me, woe to me, who have been astonied, because I am a man of polluted lips, and dwell among a people of polluted lips, and my eyes have seen the King, the mighty Lord.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:109
verses.text: How terrible to-day is this place! For this is none other than the house of God and the gate of heaven; because Thou hast been seen eye to eye, O Lord.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:110
verses.text: Now, I pray, may Thy grace be with us, O Lord; purge away our impurities, and sanctify our lips; unite the voices of our insignificance with the sanctification of seraphim and archangels.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:111
verses.text: Glory be to Thy tender mercies, because Thou hast associated the earthly with the heavenly.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:112
verses.text: And he proceeds, saying in secret this prayer, in a bowing posture:—  XII.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:113
verses.text: And with those heavenly powers we give Thee thanks, even we, Thine insignificant, pithless, and feeble servants; because Thou hast granted unto us Thy great grace which cannot be repaid.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:114
verses.text: For indeed Thou didst take upon Thee our human nature, that Thou mightest bestow life on us through Thy divinity; Thou didst exalt our low condition; Thou didst raise our ruined state; Thou didst rouse up our mortality; Thou didst wash away our sins; Thou didst blot out the guilt of our sins; Thou didst enlighten our intelligence, and Thou didst condemn our enemy, O Lord our God; and Thou didst cause the insignificance of our pithless nature to triumph.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:115
verses.text: Here follow the words of institution, after which:—  Through the tender mercies of Thy grace poured out, O clement One, pardon our offences and sins; blot out my offences in the judgment.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:116
verses.text: And on account of all Thy aids and Thy favours to us, we shall ascribe unto Thee praise, honour, thanksgiving, and adoration, now, always, and for ever and ever.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:117
verses.text: The Priest signs the sacraments.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:118
verses.text: The response is made.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:119
verses.text: Amen.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:120
verses.text: The Deacon.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:121
verses.text: In your minds.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:122
verses.text: Pray for peace with us.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:123
verses.text: The Priest says this prayer bowing, and in a low voice:—  O Lord God Almighty, accept this oblation for the whole Holy Catholic Church, and for all the pious and righteous fathers who have been pleasing to Thee, and for all the prophets and apostles, and for all the martyrs and confessors, and for all that mourn, that are in straits, and are sick, and for all that are under difficulties and trials, and for all the weak and the oppressed, and for all the dead that have gone from amongst us; then for all that ask a prayer from our weakness, and for me, a degraded and feeble sinner.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:124
verses.text: O Lord our God, according to Thy mercies and the multitude of Thy favours, look upon Thy people, and on me, a feeble man, not according to my sins and my follies, but that they may become worthy of the forgiveness of their sins through this holy body, which they receive with faith, through the grace of Thy mercy for ever and ever, Amen.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:125
verses.text: The Priest says this prayer of inclination in secret:—  XIII.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:126
verses.text: Do Thou, O Lord, through Thy many and ineffable mercies, make the memorial good and acceptable with that of all the pious and righteous fathers who have been pleading before Thee in the commemoration of the body and blood of Thy Christ, which we offer to Thee upon Thy pure and holy altar, as Thou hast taught us; and grant unto us Thy rest all the days of this life.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:127
verses.text: He proceeds with the Great Oblation:—  O Lord our God, bestow on us Thy rest and peace all the days of this life, that all the inhabitants of the earth may know Thee, that Thou art the only true God the Father, and Thou didst send our Lord Jesus Christ, Thy Son and Thy beloved; and He Himself our Lord and God came and taught us all purity and holiness.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:128
verses.text: Make remembrance of prophets, apostles, martyrs, confessors, bishops, doctors, priests, deacons, and all the sons of the Holy Catholic Church who have been signed with the sign of life, of holy baptism.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:129
verses.text: We also, O Lord:  He proceeds:—  We, Thy degraded, weak, and feeble servants who are congregated in Thy name, and now stand before Thee, and have received with joy the form which is from Thee, praising, glorifying, and exalting, commemorate and celebrate this great, awful, holy, and divine mystery of the passion, death, burial, and resurrection of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:130
verses.text: And may Thy Holy Spirit come, O Lord, and rest upon this oblation of Thy servants which they offer, and bless and sanctify it; and may it be unto us, O Lord, for the propitiation of our offences and the forgiveness of our sins, and for a grand hope of resurrection from the dead, and for a new life in the kingdom of the heavens, with all who have been pleasing before Him.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:131
verses.text: And on account of the whole of Thy wonderful dispensation towards us, we shall render thanks unto Thee, and glorify Thee without ceasing in Thy Church, redeemed by the precious blood of Thy Christ, with open mouths and joyful countenances:  Canon.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:132
verses.text: Ascribing praise, honour, thanksgiving, and adoration to Thy holy, loving, and life-giving name, now, always, and for ever.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:133
verses.text: The Priest signs the mysteries with the cross, and they respond:—  Amen.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:134
verses.text: The Priest bows himself and kisses the altar, first in the middle, then at the two sides right and left, and says this prayer:—  Have mercy upon me, O God, down to the words, and sinners shall be converted unto Thee: and unto Thee lift I up mine eyes, down to have mercy upon us, O Lord, have mercy upon us.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:135
verses.text: Also stretch forth Thy hand, and let Thy right hand save me, O Lord; may Thy mercies remain upon me, O Lord, for ever, and despise not the works of Thy hands.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:136
verses.text: Then he says this prayer:—  XIV.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:137
verses.text: O Christ, peace of those in heaven and great rest of those below, grant that Thy rest and peace may dwell in the four parts of the world, but especially in Thy Holy Catholic Church; grant that the priesthood with the government may have peace; cause wars to cease from the ends of the earth, and scatter the nations that delight in wars, that we may enjoy the blessing of living in tranquillity and peace, in all temperance and fear of God.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:138
verses.text: Spare the offences and sins of the dead, through Thy grace and mercies for ever.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:139
verses.text: And to those who are around the altar he says:—  Bless, O Lord.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:140
verses.text: Bless, O Lord.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:141
verses.text: And he puts on the incense with which he fumes himself, and says:—  Sweeten, O Lord our God, the unpleasing savour of our souls through the sweetness of Thy love, and through it cleanse me from the stains of my sin, and forgive me my offences and sins, whether known or unknown to me.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:142
verses.text: A second time he takes the incense with both hands, and censes the mysteries; presently he says:—  The clemency of Thy grace, O our Lord and God, gives us access to these renowned, holy, life-giving, and divine mysteries, unworthy though we be.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:143
verses.text: The Priest repeats these words once and again, and at each interval unites his hands over his breast in the form of a cross.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:144
verses.text: He kisses the altar in the middle, and receives with both hands the upper oblation; and looking up, says:—  Praise be to Thy holy name, O Lord Jesus Christ, and adoration to Thy majesty, always and for ever, Amen.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:145
verses.text: For He is the living and life-giving bread which cometh down from heaven, and giveth life to the whole world, of which they who eat die not; and they who receive it are saved by it, and do not see corruption, and live through it for ever; and Thou art the antidote of our mortality, and the resurrection of our entire frame.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 4:146
verses.text: XV.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 7:1
verses.text: XVI.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 7:2
verses.text: Praise to Thy holy name, O Lord.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 7:3
verses.text: (As above.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 7:4
verses.text: )  The Priest kisses the host in the form of a cross; in such a way, however, that his lips do not touch it, but appear to kiss it; and he says:—  Glory to Thee, O Lord; glory to Thee, O Lord, on account of Thine unspeakable gift to us, for ever.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 7:5
verses.text: Then he draws nigh to the fraction of the host, which he accomplishes with both his hands, saying:—  We draw nigh, O Lord, with true faith, and break with thanksgiving and sign through Thy mercy the body and blood of our Life-giver, Jesus Christ, in the name of the Father, Son, and Holy Ghost.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 7:6
verses.text: And, naming the Trinity, he breaks the host, which he holds in his hands, into two parts: and the one which is in his left hand he lays down on the disk; with the other, which he holds in his right hand, he signs the chalice, saying:—  The precious blood is signed with the holy body of our Lord Jesus Christ.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 7:7
verses.text: In the name of the Father, and the Son, and the Holy Ghost for ever.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 7:8
verses.text: And they respond:—  Amen.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 7:9
verses.text: Then he dips it even to the middle in the chalice, and signs with it the body which is in the paten, saying:—  The holy body is signed with the propitiatory blood of our Lord Jesus Christ.

verses.name: Early Liturgies 7:10
verses.text: In the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Ghost for ever.
